case_vignette: A 53-year-old female with a past medical history of multiple myeloma presents to dermatology clinic with multiple yellow, irritated spots under the eyes! She reports the lesions developed about four months ago, beginning as a red spot that will enlargen, bleed, and then may scab over with yellow material! She denies any new facial creams, topical treatments, or new medications! She does not have any new dogs or cats!   Physical examination is remarkable for hepatosplenomegaly and periocular bilaterally are yellow-pink multilobular papules and plaques!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple yellow, irritated spots under my eyes that started about four months ago. They began as red spots that enlarged, bled, and then scabbed over with yellow material.
Have you had any changes in your skin elsewhere on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my skin elsewhere on my body.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started using any new skincare products or medications around the time the symptoms started?
No, I haven't started using any new skincare products, medications, or have any known allergies.
Is there any prior personal or family history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
I have a past medical history of multiple myeloma, but no mention of other skin conditions or autoimmune diseases in my family history.
Have you experienced any weight loss, night sweats, or lymph node enlargement recently?
There was no mention of weight loss, night sweats, or lymph node enlargement in my case.
Final Diagnosis: Xanthelasma
